fields.MHCLG input description: MHCLG provides the funding and assesses the bids
fields.Policy Objective: Freeports are a variant of Free Trade Zones, which are advantageous where a country’s trade barriers are high. The Chancellor has therefore proposed that measures should also be taken to incentivise private sector-led investment in these regions. This investment should help to generate growth in output and employment, ultimately establishing self-perpetuating investment-rich ‘clusters’ near ports. This is a manifesto commitment
fields.Service description: Freeport boards will prepare applications to win freeport status. They can make use of capacity support provided as part of the fund

fields.Service Name: Get funding from the Bellwin Scheme
fields.Legacy users needs data: Emergency financial support during a disaster.
fields.Policy Objective: To meet the shortfall in a local authority's emergency budget
fields.Service description:
The scheme provides emergency financial assistance to local
authorities in England. Assistance under the scheme is usually given as the result of an emergency caused by the weather, but relief may also be available in other circumstances: for example, the outbreak of foot and mouth disease  the explosion at Buncefield fuel terminal, the riots of August 2011, and the Grenfell Tower disaster.

fields.Service Name: Apply for Waking Watch Relief Fund
fields.Legacy users needs data: Live in a building that has an affordable fire safety plan
fields.MHCLG input description: We expect that delivery of the fund will be split between LAs with the most unsafe buildings and central delivery for other LAs and the social sector. Under this option we will reserve a chunk of the £30m funding for those LAs/Regions with the largest number of high-rise buildings with potentially unsafe cladding. These LAs would be provided with an initial and notional allocation proportionate to the number of buildings in their area with unsafe cladding systems. The LA will be able to draw down funds directly from the Department to cover costs up to that notional amount. The balance would be held back and be used for buildings located in all other areas and applications for social sector funding and would be administered by MHCLG on a first come first served basis.
fields.Policy Objective: replace Waking Watch with alarm systems in High Rise residential buildings with unsafe cladding where Waking Watch costs have been passed onto leaseholders. The fund will be for the benefit of leaseholders in eligible buildings over 17.70m by reducing the ongoing costs of Waking Watch and avoiding the need for them to meet the upfront capital costs for the installation of fire alarms.
fields.Service description: The owner (/Responsible Person) applies for funding to pay for an alarm system in a High Rise residential building with unsafe cladding where Waking Watch costs have been passed onto leaseholders. The fund will be for the benefit of leaseholders in eligible buildings over 17.70m by reducing the ongoing costs of Waking Watch and avoiding the need for them to meet the upfront capital costs for the installation of fire alarms.

fields.Service Name: Get a new energy performance certificate
fields.Legacy users needs data: get an energy performance assessment done to the property
fields.MHCLG input description: MHCLG runs the register of assessors and the database of energy certificates, which are hosted on GOV.UK.
fields.Policy Objective: The policy aims to improve the energy efficiency of buildings and thereby contribute to the UK's target of net carbon neutrality by 2050. The UK’s building stock is a significant contributor to the country’s carbon footprint. Energy certificates are a valuable tool to support property owners to understand and improve the energy performance of their homes and commercial buildings.
fields.Service description: An energy certificate is required when selling or letting most houses, flats or commercial properties. This service allows users to find accredited energy assessors to undertake energy assessments and issue certificates.
Suggested Alternative End User Needs: Live in/sell an energy efficient property
fields.User 2 Needs: I need an energy performance certificate to let my property.
fields.User 3 Needs: I need to know how to improve the energy efficiency of my property.
fields.User 1 Needs: I need an energy performance certificate to sell my property.
fields.Service phase 1: Views on GOV.UK guidance on buying, selling or letting
fields.Service phase 2: Uses Getting a new energy certificate on GOV.UK to find energy assessors
fields.Service phase 5: Receives a link to energy certificate for the property
fields.Service phase 6: Views the energy certificate for the property on Find an energy certificate on GOV.UK

Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy (BEIS)

fields.MHCLG input description: The New Homes Bonus is a grant paid by central government to local councils to reflect and incentivize housing growth in their areas. It is based on the amount of extra Council Tax revenue raised for new-build homes, conversions and long-term empty homes brought back into use. There is also an extra payment for providing affordable homes.

get support if your family is facing serious issues
fields.MHCLG input description: MHCLG provides funding either through payment by results or upfront payments; spot checks and assurance visits; and by collating quantitative info on families worked with and outcomes achieved
fields.Service Start Date: This initial iteration started in 2012, the current one in 2015
fields.Level of Funding: A total of £1.1 billion of funding has been committed to March 2021, with an additional £165 million announced in November 2020 for 2021-22.
fields.Policy Objective: The programme intended to help up to 400,000 families “achieve significant and sustained progress against all their multiple problems and make work and ambition for all families” by 2020. The programme is primarily a payment by results scheme, where local authorities claim payment when their work with families results in significant and sustained progress against their identified problems, or achieve continuous employment.
fields.Service description: The programme conducts targeted interventions for families experiencing multiple problems, including crime, anti-social behaviour, truancy, unemployment, mental health problems and domestic abuse.

fields.Service Name: Apply for Local Infrastructure Funding (Getting Building Fund)
fields.Legacy users needs data: Get funding to begin works on "shovel-ready" infrastructure projects
fields.MHCLG input description: Funding will be provided to Mayoral Combined Authorities and Local Enterprise Partnerships based on the size of their local population and their resilience to dealing with Covid-19
fields.Policy Objective: an injection of funding into shovel- ready schemes will create jobs and raise overall demand in the economy
fields.Service description: Funding will be provided through LEPs and MCAs to projects that are ready to begin work to enable them to do so.

Get longer term accommodation
fields.MHCLG input description: MHCLG provides funding
fields.Level of Funding: £44 million grant funding and £6 million revenue funding
fields.Policy Objective: The fund aims to free up hostel and refuge spaces and provide accommodation that people can move straight into from the streets to avoid having to stay in a hostel or refuge all together.
fields.Service description:
The Move On Fund will contribute towards the capital costs of developing move-on accommodation for people leaving homelessness hostels and refuges for survivors of domestics abuse. This could involve: i) the purchase and repair of existing accommodation, ii) the development of new build properties iii) the lease and repair of existing properties. Bidding is open to all organisations who are, or intend to become, qualified as Homes
England investment partners. This includes housing associations, local authorities, private sector developers and community groups among others.

fields.Policy Objective: First time buyers get a discount on buying a home to help them get on the property ladder and receipts are used to pay for affordable housing
fields.Service description: First-time buyers are entitled to relief for the first £300,000 of Stamp Duty on properties up to a value of £500,000. The conveyancer arranges for the discount to be applied.

help identify, prioritise and address the needs of those families who have many multiple and complex needs
fields.MHCLG input description: MHCLG set the parameters for funding and give examples of the plans
fields.Policy Objective: Provide a plan of action so that families can break out of negative cycles of unemployment, abuse, etc. Taking a whole family approach.
fields.Service description: A Troubled Families Outcome Plan (TFOP) is required for all authorities delivering the TFP.This should set out what each local authority and its partners consider to be the indicators of eligibility and successful outcomes against the programme’s six headline problems
Suggested Alternative End User Needs: Support families who have many multiple and complex needs

fields.Legacy users needs data: accommodation on leaving prison, so that I do not become a rough sleeper
fields.Provider Type: Prisons, local authority, probation staff, charities
fields.Policy Objective: tbc
fields.Service description: In the 12 weeks up to their release date, offenders involved in the pilot receive intensive support, targeted to their individual needs, to tackle issues like alcohol and drug dependency. Following release, offenders are given up to two years of secure and stable accommodation, funded by their benefits where the local housing market permits, as well as specific assistance with employment, education, benefits and family engagement.
